hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Regime Transition via 20D Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence > 60%) and its 20-day realized volatility compresses below its 30-day rolling 25th percentile, a subsequent daily close above the 20-day Bollinger Band upper envelope (2 std) will signal a transition to a BULL regime, with the breakout move continuing for an average of +8% over the next 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility compression in neutral regimes often precedes directional breaks. A high-confidence neutral reading suggests equilibrium; breaking above a 2σ Bollinger Band with volume confirms institutional accumulation and regime shift initiation.
entry_conditions: Volume on breakout day > 20-day average volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: 5 trading days OR +8% price appreciation from entry (whichever comes first)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Daily close back below the 20-day SMA
exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 trading days if TP/SL not hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If more than 40% of such signals are followed by a failed breakout (price returns below 20-day SMA within 3 days) OR if the average 5-day forward return is not statistically >0 at 95% confidence.
